articles.headline: Prius Adds to Toyota’s Woes as Stock Drops in Tokyo
articles.snippet: As Japanese officials ordered an inquiry into problems with the brakes on the 2010 Prius, Toyota’s stock price dropped about 3.5 percent in early trading Thursday.
articles.abstract: As Japanese officials ordered an inquiry into problems with the brakes on the 2010 Prius, Toyota’s stock price dropped about 3.5 percent in early trading Thursday.
articles.lead_paragraph: The hybrid-electric Prius has long been Toyota’s “green car,” the symbol of the automaker’s engineering prowess and its big bet on the kind of car consumers will want to buy for decades to come.

articles.headline: For Scots, a Scourge Unleashed by a Bottle
articles.snippet: Buckfast Tonic Wine is a symbol of Scotland’s drinking problems at a time when it is debating how to address them.
articles.abstract: Buckfast Tonic Wine is a symbol of Scotland’s drinking problems at a time when it is debating how to address them.
articles.lead_paragraph: COATBRIDGE, Scotland — What is it about Buckfast Tonic Wine that makes it so alluring to consumers and yet so repulsive to politicians?

articles.headline: Best Cameras for $300 or Less
articles.snippet: An experiment begun in 2001 continues: Which camera offers the most bang for relatively few bucks?
articles.abstract: An experiment begun in 2001 continues: Which camera offers the most bang for relatively few bucks?
articles.lead_paragraph: In 2001, I conducted a search for the best camera with a street price under $300. I’ve repeated the experiment every year since.

articles.headline: Rivals Await Blankfein’s Bonus at Goldman Sachs
articles.snippet: The compensation for Lloyd C. Blankfein will set a new benchmark for pay throughout the industry.
articles.abstract: The compensation for Lloyd C. Blankfein will set a new benchmark for pay throughout the industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Voice-mail boxes inside Goldman Sachs lit up on Jan. 21 with an unusual message from the bank’s chief executive  a bit of Wall Street speak that sounded like the makings of a book on Zen and the Art of Money-Making.
articles.byline: By Graham Bowley and Zachery Kouwe

articles.headline: LaHood Backtracks on ‘Stop Driving It’
articles.snippet: Ray LaHood , the plainspoken transportation secretary who told Toyota owners to stop driving the vehicles with pedal problems, became an advertisement for the virtue of remaining scripted.
articles.abstract: Ray LaHood , the plainspoken transportation secretary who told Toyota owners to stop driving the vehicles with pedal problems, became an advertisement for the virtue of remaining scripted.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Ray LaHood testified before a Congressional panel on Wednesday morning, something he had done many times before, and made points that  he thought  he had made many times before.
articles.byline: By Mark Leibovich and Matthew L. Wald

articles.headline: In a Prius Preserve, Shaken Fans
articles.snippet: Problems with other Toyota models have owners of the Prius wondering about the safety of their own vehicles.
articles.abstract: Problems with other Toyota models have owners of the Prius wondering about the safety of their own vehicles.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Here in the country’s environmental hotbed, where plastic bags are banned, composting is mandatory, and even some Yellow Cabs run green, Thursday will dawn with at least eight fewer Toyota Priuses  the eco-friendly status symbol of the hybrid set  on the roads.

articles.headline: Europeans Revitalize Plants to Save Jobs
articles.snippet: Europeans are making old plants more modern and effective rather than watching workers or companies deemed uncompetitive fall by the wayside.
articles.abstract: Europeans are making old plants more modern and effective rather than watching workers or companies deemed uncompetitive fall by the wayside.
articles.lead_paragraph: BERLIN  The soaring glass and iron Siemens factory here opened almost exactly a century ago. At first, it churned out electricity turbines, then munitions during World War II before being looted by the Soviets, which required it to be rebuilt at the dawn of the cold war.

articles.headline: U.S. Starts Inquiry Into Brake Problems on Prius
articles.snippet: The Prius was drawn into the mounting crisis for Toyota as safety regulators in Washington ordered an inquiry into brake problems on the 2010 model.
articles.abstract: The Prius was drawn into the mounting crisis for Toyota as safety regulators in Washington ordered an inquiry into brake problems on the 2010 model.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  No sooner had Toyota dealerships begun to repair accelerator pedals on millions of recalled vehicles than the carmaker said it was considering yet another major recall, this time for problems with the brakes on its Prius hybrid.

articles.headline: Investors Fear Europe’s Woes May Extend Global Slump
articles.snippet: Just as America’s recession begins to ebb, trouble is brewing in Europe that may prolong a downturn and ricochet through the global economy as it struggles to recover.
articles.abstract: Just as America’s recession begins to ebb, trouble is brewing in Europe that may prolong a downturn and ricochet through the global economy as it struggles to recover.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just as America’s recession begins to ebb, trouble is brewing in Europe that may prolong a downturn on the Continent and ricochet through the global economy as it struggles toward a recovery.
articles.byline: By Javier C. Hernández and Jack Ewing
